critique: This document is an executive order from 1914 coordinating the efforts of various government departments to provide relief and transportation to American citizens abroad due to disturbed conditions in Europe. It focuses on inter-departmental cooperation and logistical arrangements. There's no indication of ideological bias, immigration policy stance, expansion of executive power, or federalism concerns. It's primarily an administrative order. It doesn't touch upon national security vs. civil liberties, economic regulation, or social inclusion. Therefore, most axes should be scored as neutral.
